parse.title: List of incidents of violence against women in Spain

text.*:
This is a list of incidents of violence against women in Spain. The Ministry of Health, Social Services and Equality publishes statistics on violence against women and counts every death. Also, media in Spain reports every case of violence against women that results in a death.

In the last decade about 700 women have been killed in Spain by their partners or ex-partners.[1] Since 1999, the number of killed women is over 1,000.

This list is incomplete; you can help by expanding it.

Contents

  • 1 Before 2003
  • 2 2003 - 2011
  • 3 2012- 2014
  • 4 2015
  • 5 2016
    • 5.1 Gender violence murders
    • 5.2 Other cases
  • 6 2017
    • 6.1 Gender violence murders
    • 6.2 Other cases
  • 7 2018
    • 7.1 Gender violence murders
    • 7.2 Other cases
  • 8 See also
  • 9 References
  • 10 External links

Before 2003[edit]

  • November 13, 1992: Alcasser Girls: 3 teenage girls from Alcàsser, Valencia, Spain, who were kidnapped, raped, assaulted and murdered after hitchhiking to get to a nightclub.
  • April 1993: Kidnapping of Anabel Segura: 2 men kidnap and later (whe she was trying to escape) murder a 22 year old woman.[2]
  • December 17, 1997: Ana Orantes: After her testimony shown on a television program, she was killed by her last husband.[3][4] It caused a big repercussion about gender violence, and as a consequence, the restructuring of the Criminal Code of Spain.[5]
  • April 20, 1997: Murder of Eva Blanco: Spanish high school student who was murdered in Algete, Community of Madrid. The case remained unsolved until 2015
  • October 9/10, 1999: Murder of Rocío Wanninkhof: a Dutch-Spanish teenage girl who was murdered in her hometown of Mijas

2003 - 2011[edit]

  • Women killed in gender violence cases
    • 2003: 71 women[6]
    • 2004: 72 women[7]
    • 2005: 57 women[8]
    • 2006: 69 women[9]
    • 2007: 71 women[10]
    • 2008: 76 women[11]
    • 2009: 56 women[12]
    • 2010: 73 women[13]
    • 2011: 62 women[14]
  • 17 May 2003: Murder of Sandra Palo: A woman (22) is raped, run over by a car and burnt alive by 4 minors (in the 14-18 age range) in Madrid.[15]
  • 24 January 2009: Murder of Marta del Castillo: a Spanish high school student who disappeared and was presumably murdered
  • 14 August 2009: Murder of Sonia Carabantes: Murder of a 17 year old girl that helped to solve the case of Rocío Wanninkhof

2012- 2014[edit]

  • Women killed in gender violence cases:
    • 2012: 52 women[16]
    • 2013: 54 women[17]
    • 2014: 55 women[18]
  • June 30, 2012: A man kills and butchers his partner in Cadrete.[19]

2015[edit]

60 women were killed in Spain in cases of violence against women[20]

  • January 12: A man (70) kills his ex-partner (70) and her sister (64) in Elche. Later, he commits suicide. Five minutes of silence were observed for the double crime.[21][22][23][24]
  • January 17: A woman (69) is killed in Orba, Alicante. Her partner flees to Germany, where he confesses the crime in the airport to police. Silent demonstrations were held in Alicante and Valencia.[25]
  • January 21: A man (44) kills his wife (39) and then he commits suicide in Terrassa. They had a 6 years old child. About 200 people meet in front of the city hall to protest against violence against women.[26]
  • February 4: A woman is stabbed to death by a man in Arrecife. They met some months ago.[27]
  • February 6: A woman is strangled in Ronda. About 30 people protest against the crime.[28]
  • February 12: A man (47) stabs to death his partner (38) in Valencia.[29]
  • March 9: A man (75) confesses to have killed his wife (76) six months before in San Miguel de Salinas.[30]
  • March 10: A woman (43) in killed by her partner in Xàbia.[31]
  • March 12: A woman (23) is thrown out a van driven by her husband (24) in Cáceres and dies due to the injuries.[32][33]
  • March 29: A man kills his wife (31) in Alhaurín de la Torre and then he commits suicide. About 100 people gather in the city hall square to protest against the crime.[34][35]
  • March 30: A man shoots his wife (24) in Lleida and then attempts suicide.[36]
  • April 2: A man (34) stabs his wife (29) to death in Vitoria-Gasteiz.[37]
  • May 3: A man (50) kills his wife (47) and her boss (57) in Sorbas and Níjar respectively.[38]

2016[edit]

Gender violence murders[edit]

44 women were killed in gender violence cases.[39]

  • January 4: A man (41) strangles his partner (43) in Madrid.[40]
  • January 5: A man stabs his partner (33) in Galápagos, Guadalajara.[41]
  • January 7: A man (27) drowns his partner (21) in a swamp in Alange, Badajoz.[42]
  • January 11: A man is detained in Quintanar de la Orden, Toledo after his wife (59) is found stabbed. He is released 4 days later becauses it is found that the DNA of the knife was his brother´s (the brother-in-law's victim),[43] who confessed the crime.[44] Investigation still does not rule out an involvement of the husband.[45]
  • February 22: A man (41) shoots his ex-partner (37) in Zaragoza.[46]
  • March 14: A man (46) is accused of stabbing his partner (34) in Gijón, Asturias.[47] Finally he was sentenced to 4 years for reckless homicide as the judge considered that he had stabbed her in a struggle to try to pick the knife from her hands, but without intending to kill her.[48]
  • July 24: A man is arrested accused of suffocating his wife (49) in Bilbao.[49] He was acquitted for lack of evidence in 2018.[50]

Other cases[edit]

  • July 7: La Manada sexual abuse case: A group of five men sexually abused a 18-year-old girl in a portal.[51]
  • August 21–22: Murder of Diana Quer: A 18 year old woman is abducted and murdered.[52]
  • August 24, 2016: A man ties his ex-wife to her bed and beats her in front of their children in Villa de Vallecas.[53]

2017[edit]

Gender violence murders[edit]

51 women were killed in gender violence cases.[54]

  • January 1: A man (24) defenestrates his partner (25) in Madrid[55]
  • January 4: A man (20) stabs and kills his partner (40) in Rivas-Vaciamadrid[56]
  • January 15: A man (31) slays his ex-partner (33) in Huércal, Almería[57]
  • January 17: A man confesses to have cut his wife´s (48) throat and thrown the corpse to a river in Burlada, Navarre.[58]
  • January 28: A man (59) stabs his wife (55) in O Carballino, Orense.[59]
  • January 30: Woman (40) killed by her husband (40) in Seseña, Toledo[60]
  • February 5: A man (44) stabs his wife (38) in Mora, Toledo.[61]
  • February 7: A man (82) kills his wife (79) while she was sleeping in Súria, Barcelona.[62]
  • February 11: A civil guard (31) shoots her partner (26) and later commits suicide in Seseña, Toledo.[63]
  • February 13: A man (57) stabs to death his wife (46) and her daughter (18), his stepdaughter, in Daimiel, Ciudad Real.[64]
  • February 19: A man (86) stabs his wife (79) in a nursing home care in Campello, Alicante.[65]
  • February 20: A man (47) makes explode two butane cylinders to kill his ex-partner (52) in Redondela, Pontevedra. Both die.[66]
  • February 21: A man stabs his ex-partner (34) in Santa Perpetua, Barcelona.[67]
  • February 21: A man (54) is arrested accused of throwing out his ex-partner (48) out of the hollow of a staircase of a building in Valencia.[68]
  • February 21: A woman (47) appears dead in Gandía, Valencia. A man with restraining order is arrested.[69]
  • February 22: In Villanueva del Fresno, Badajoz a woman (91) dies due to the stabbing wounds inflicted by her husband (91) two days prior.[70] The sons does not consider this a gender violence case,[71] but is counted as such by the Ministry.[72]
  • March 1: A man slaughters his partner (32) and then manipulates the gas pipes to cause an explosion and commit suicide. In Madrid.[73]
  • March 29: A man (47) strangles his wife (42) and smothers their two children (ages, 5 and 8). Then he commits suicide by throwing himself out the window. in Campo de Criptana, Ciudad Real.[74]
  • March 31: A man (34) strangles his partner (23) and then surrenders to the police in Telde, Gran Canaria.[75]
  • April 4: A man (36) beats to death his partner (44) and then tries to burn the house in La Laguna, Santa Cruz de Tenerife.[76]
  • April 10: A man (24) beats to death his partner (29) in El Alquián, Almería and then commits suicide by hanging.[77]
  • April 21: A man (38) strangles his partner (45) in Barcelona.[78]
  • May 2: A man stabs and kills his partner (44) and their child in Alcobendas, Madrid.[79]
  • May 5: A man strangles his wife (39), puts the corpse in a suitcase and throws it to a river in Alcolea del Río, Sevilla.[80]
  • May 12: A man (40) kills ex-partner (27) and confesses to the police in Madrid.[81]
  • May 21: A man sets fire to the car in which he and his partner (48) were, both burned to death in La Llagosta, Barcelona.[82]
  • May 26: A woman (55) is strangled by her husband (61) who tries to commit suicide by stabbing himself. In Madrid.[83]
  • May 27: A man (48) stabs his co-worker and ex-partner (31) in Molina de Segura, Murcia.[84]
  • May 27: A man (43) strangles with a plastic bag his partner (37) in Collado Villalba, Madrid.[85]
  • June 13: A man (51) shots his partner (55) in Las Gabias, Granada.[86]
  • June 24: A man stabs his ex-partner (39) in front of her 6 years old child in Seville.[87]
  • June 25: A man (43) stabs his partner (29) in a car and surrenders to the police in Salou, Tarragona.[88]
  • July 15: A man (71) kills with an axe his wife (66) in Huéscar, Granada.[89]
  • July 17: A man beats to death his partner (38) and then burnts the house in Valencia.[90]
  • August 2: A man (71) beats to death his wife (63) and surrenders to the police in Getafe, Madrid.[91]
  • August 5: A man (39) beats to death his partner (38) in Santa Cruz de Tenerife.[92]
  • August 16: A man (49) shots his partner (48) and then commits suicide in Totana, Murcia.[93]
  • August 24: A woman (42) dies stabbed by her husband in Arroyo de la Luz, Cáceres.[94] Although this death appears on the official list of the Ministry, the detainee was released in December of the same year when the investigation considered that this was a case of self-defense.[95]
  • September 25: A man (22) stabs his ex-partner (20) in Cartagena, Murcia.[96]
  • September 28: A man (33) slaughters his partner (32) and then commits suicide by throwing himself out of a window in Sestao, Biscay.[97]
  • October 1: A man (33) shots his partner (22) and their 15 months baby and commits suicide in Barcelona.[98]
  • October 3: A man (49) stabs his ex-partner (45) in Miranda de Ebro, Burgos.[99]
  • October 14: A man shots his ex-partner (66) in Rubí, Barcelona and is detained after trying to escape.[100]
  • October 22: A man (38) strangles his partner (38) and then commits suicide in Cuevas del Almanzora, Almería.[101]
  • November 1: A man (45) kills his partner (28) in Arona, Tenerife.[102]
  • November 9: A man (31) shots his ex-partner (28) in front of a school and at the sigth of their 3 years old son and then commits suicide. In Elda, Alicante.[103]
  • November 24: A German (41) drives a whole day to shoot his ex-partner (34) who was in Vinaròs, Castellón hiding from him. Then commits suicide.[104]
  • November 30: A man (40) hits his wife (53), who dies in a hospital in Guadassuar, Valencia.[105]
  • December 23: A man (29) forces his ex-partner (20) to ride in his car and then crashes it against a pole in Villareal, Castellón.[106]
  • December 25: A man (35) stabs his partner (30) in Sant Adrià del Besòs, Barcelona. He is arrested after taking a lot of pills.[107]
  • December 28: A man (40) stabs his partner (37) in front of their three children in Azuqueca, Guadalajara.[108]

Other cases[edit]

  • January 18: A man (78) suffocates his wife (79) with a pillow, then commits suicide. He left a note explaining that he did that to end her suffering as she had Alzheimer.[109]
  • February 3: A father, (27) after an argument with his wife in a hospital in Madrid, picks their 1 year old child and throws himself out of a window, dying both.[110]
  • May 18: A woman (55) denounces the partner (29) of her niece whom he had tried to strangle. He kills the complainant before the police can arrest him. In Caudete, Albacete.[111]
  • May 24: A man (48) who had been accused of gender abuse by his wife (45) 7 years prior has a sex change during the judicial process and claims that Spanish gender violence law no loger applies to the case.[112]
  • June 1: A man (44) hits his partner (31) and suffocates their 8 months old baby.[113]
  • November 12: A man (28) murders his two-year-old daughter after learning that her partner (24) wanted to break up with him.[114]

2018[edit]

Gender violence murders[edit]

  • January 19: A man (68) stabs and kills his ex-partner (47) and has a car accident while trying to scape in Santa Cruz de Tenerife.[115]
  • January 29: A man (91) poisons his wife (90) in a nursing home care in Mazarambroz, Toledo.[116]
  • February 4: A man (73) denounces the disappearance of his wife (53) in Guadix (Granada) but finally confesses to have killed and buried her.[117]
  • February 12: A woman (43) disappears in Navia, Asturias. Her corpse is found 3 weeks later. A man (42) who was already infamous in the village for claiming to be his procurer[118] is arrested and finally confesses the crime.[119]
  • March 7: A man stabs his partner (44) in La Viñuela, Málaga.[120]
  • March 24: A man allegedly runs over his partner three times until he kills her in Toledo.[121]
  • March 30: A woman (48) is allegedly suffocated by her old partner (38) in Albox (Almería)[122]
  • April 9: A man (41) stabs and kills his wife (40) in front of their children in Blanes, Girona.[123]
  • April 11: A man (46) allegedly kills her wife (39) in Murcia. She was as Colombian human rights defendant who had to left her country due to FARC threats.[124]
  • April 20: In Vitoria-Gasteiz a man kills his ex-wife (43) and her mother, barricades himself in his house while the police surround the building, throws himself out of the window and falls on an inflatable mattress prepared by firefighters that saves his life.[125]
  • April 30: A man (36) allegedly beats ex-partner (36) until killing her in Burgos.[126]
  • May 11: A man (24) shoots his partner (21) in a shooting range, then commits suicide, in Las Gabias, Granada.[127]
  • June 8: A man (64) stabs his wife (49) and then tries to burn the house in Las Palmas.[128]
  • June 17: A man (53) allegedly shoots his partner (44) in Guadahortuna, Granada.[129]
  • June 18: A man (48) suffocates his partner (40) then surrenders to the police in Badalona, Barcelona.[130]
  • June 18: A man shoots his wife (47) in O Porriño, Lugo. Then commits suicide.[131]
  • June 25: A man (39) strangles his partner (37) in Zaragoza.[132]
  • July 5: A man (47) beats his partner (44) and strangles her with a cable in Madrid.[133]
  • July 6: A man (88) stabs his wife (84) and commits suicide by throwing himself of out a window in La Felguera, Asturias.[134]
  • July 7: A man (33) dissobeys the restraining order and stabs his partner (24) in Lepe, Huelva. He fled from the authorities,[135]but he was detained the follwing day.[136]
  • July 9: A man (59) beats to death his wife (48) in Collado Villalba, Madrid.[137]
  • July 14: A man (45) strangles her partner (40) and suffocates their 3 and 5 year old daughters. Then he hangs himself (he apparently was trying to pass it as a suicide pact with his wife). In La Orotava, Santa Cruz de Tenerife.[138]
  • July 18: A man (54) stabs his wife (57) in A Coruña.[139]
  • July 24: A retired cop (69) shoots his wife (62) in Astorga, León.[140]
  • August 6: A man (82) stabs his wife (78) in Barcelona.[141]
  • August 14: A man (39) stabs his partner (21) in Dúrcal, Granada.[142]
  • August 19: A man (56) shots his wife (50) in front of their two sons in Cabana de Bergantiños, A Coruña.[143]
  • August 23: A man (27) stabs his girlfriend (35). A few days before they had announced their marriage compromise. In Barcelona.[144]
  • August 27: A man (57) strangles his partner (60) in Orihuela, Alicante.[145]
  • August 27: A man (48) beats to death his wife (38). His mother helped him clean the crime scene. In Aoiz, Navarra.[146]
  • September 6: A man (67) allegedly kills his mother (92) and his wife (68) in Zaragoza.[147]
  • September 10: A man (51) stabs his partner (29) in La Caridad, Asturias.[148]
  • September 10: A man (41) allegedly kills his partner (35), then fled from the authorities in Borriol, Castellón.[149]

Other cases[edit]

  • January 26: A man defenestrates a 27 year old woman in Madrid. No sentimental relationship.[150]
  • March 5: A 16 year old woman is allegedly sexually abused by five men in Jaen.[151]
  • March 22: Nine men in the range of 18-21 years old, are arrested in Alicante accused of raping 3 minors (14, 15 and 17 years old)[152]
  • March 27: In Castellón a man (46) with restraining order goes to his ex-partner's house. Since she wasn´t there he tries to sexually abuse her daughter (22) but he is stopped by her grandmother's partner (70), who is killed in the process. The aggressor falls into a ditch while trying to run away and is detained.[153]
  • April 16: A man hits his partner and their 7-month-old baby with a bat with the inscription "Doma-esposas" ("Wife-tamer")[154]
  • April 30: A man allegedly sets fire to his ex-partner's apartment.[155]
  • May 3: A man is arrested after kidnapping his ex-partner during 3 days.[156]
  • May 3: A woman (33) is murdered in an open field in Castrogonzalo, Zamora. At first a shepherd is arrested, but finally the police ends up arresting his 16-year-old son who tried to incriminate him[157]
  • May 17: A man (56) is arrested for allegedly holding his wife (66) and daughter (29) in his home for more than 4 months in Alcantarilla, Murcia.[158]
  • June 4: A man (35) kills his ex-sister in law (39) in Albacete. He was actually trying to go after his ex-wife.[159]
  • June 21: A prisoner (42) in regime of semi-freedom non fatally attacks his partner (40) with a hammer. The reason he was in prison is for killing with a hammer another girlfriend in 2002.[160]
  • August 13: A man (48) burns himself in Madrid after arguing with his partner (38) extending the fire around the building.[161]
  • September 12: A woman (35) escapes from his partner (37) who has kidnapped her during four months in Fuenlabrada, Madrid.[162]

See also[edit]

  • List of incidents of violence against women
